bibliography.AU: Louis, D; Lytvynenko, I; Hauet, T; Lacour, D; Hehn, M; Andrieu, S; Montaigne, F
bibliography.AF: Louis, D.; Lytvynenko, Ia.; Hauet, T.; Lacour, D.; Hehn, M.; Andrieu, S.; Montaigne, F.
bibliography.TI: Interfaces anisotropy in single crystal V/Fe/V trilayer
bibliography.SO: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
bibliography.DE: Nanomagnetism; Interface anisotropy; Epitaxial films; Single crystal Iron; Magnetization
bibliography.AB: The value and sign of V/Fe interface anisotropy are investigated. Epitaxial V/Fe/V/Au layers with different iron thicknesses were grown on single crystalline (001) MgO substrate by ultra high vacuum molecular beam epitaxy. Magnetometry was used to measure magnetization and out anisotropy field. From these values, we quantify the number of dead layers due to V/Fe or Fe/V interfaces, and compare it with the literature. We deduce that dead layers occur mostly at the bottom V/Fe interface. An average value for V/Fe and Fe/V interface anisotropy around 0 +/- 0.1 erg/cm(2) (mJ/m(2)) was thus deduced. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
bibliography.C1: [Louis, D.; Hauet, T.; Lacour, D.; Hehn, M.; Andrieu, S.; Montaigne, F.] Univ Lorraine, UMR CNRS 7198, Inst Jean Lamour, F-54506 Vandoeuvre Les Nancy, France; [Lytvynenko, Ia.] Sumy State Univ, UA-40007 Sumy, Ukraine
